title: Ghidra user scripts location
content:
Ghidra: what is default location (path) for custom scripts? Same question for custom 
.fidb
files.

answers_data.content:
When you create your first Ghidra Script from the script manager, Ghidra will ask you where it should store the script, so there is no "default path"; but note that if you left the path empty, it will automatically create (if not preexistent) a folder 
$USER_HOME/ghidra_scripts
and store the script in it. Also note that you can access a list of all known paths by right-clicking a script -> "Script Directories" I never used 
.fidb
but according to https://github.com/threatrack/ghidra-fidb-repo# you should store them in 
~/git/ghidra.bin/Ghidra/Features/FunctionID/src/main/fidb

comments.text: I use pre-built Ghidra binary, not built from source, there are no such path: ~/git/ghidra.bin/Ghidra/Features/FunctionID/src/main/fidb. My path is ../ghidra_11.1.1_PUBLIC/Ghidra/Features/FunctionID/ that contains: data, ghidra_scripts,lib.
